intro: Atractylis sojakii, commonly known as the Persian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by a series of bracts that give it a cup-like appearance. Atractylis sojakii is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
